newsitem.title: USA: Conrail, CSX in $8.4 billion merger.
newsitem.headline: Conrail, CSX in $8.4 billion merger.

text.p: CSX Corp and Conrail Inc said on Tuesday they had agreed to merge in an $8.4 billion deal that would create a freight transportation company with over $14 billion in annual revenues.
The merger pact values each Conrail share at $92.50, a rich premium over the stock's recent trading price. Conrail shares closed at 71 on Monday. CSX closed at 49-1/2.
CSX Chairman John Snow said the merger, to be completed late in 1997, would be immediately positive to cash flow and would add to earnings per share in the second year.

Snow will become chairman and chief executive of the new holding company to be formed in the merger, the companies said in a joint statement. Conrail Chairman David LeVan will become president and chief operating officer.

Under terms of the pact, about 19.9 percent of Conrail's outstanding voting shares -- or about 40 percent of its fully diluted shares and ESOP preferred stock -- will be acquired by CSX for cash at $92.50 per share, pursuant to Pennsylvania law.
The remaining 60 percent will be acquired for stock at an exchange ratio of 1.85619 CSX shares for each Conrail share.
